title: Novel Entities and Chemical Pollution in Timor-Leste

questions.question: What are novel entities in the context of planetary boundaries?
choices: Natural substances found only in Timor-Leste
Synthetic substances or naturally occurring elements mobilized by human activities
New species of plants and animals
questions.answer: Synthetic substances or naturally occurring elements mobilized by human activities

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an example of a novel entity?
choices: Naturally occurring minerals in their original state
questions.answer: Naturally occurring minerals in their original state

questions.question: What is a key characteristic of persistent organic pollutants (POPs)?
choices: They decompose quickly in the environment
They do not accumulate in living organisms
They persist in the environment and bioaccumulate in food chains
They are only found in industrial areas
questions.answer: They persist in the environment and bioaccumulate in food chains

questions.question: Which of the following is a common POP found in Timor-Leste?
questions.answer: DDT

questions.question: What is a major source of heavy metal contamination in Timor-Leste?
questions.answer: Mining and industrial processes

questions.question: What are microplastics?
choices: Large plastic debris found on beaches
Plastic particles less than 5mm in size
questions.answer: Plastic particles less than 5mm in size

questions.question: Which sector in Timor-Leste is particularly affected by persistent organic pollutants?
questions.answer: Agriculture

questions.question: What is a major challenge in waste management for Timor-Leste?
choices: Excess funding for waste management systems
Limited formal waste collection and disposal systems
Overabundance of trained waste management professionals
questions.answer: Limited formal waste collection and disposal systems

questions.question: How does plastic pollution primarily affect Timor-Leste's marine environments?
choices: It provides new habitats for marine life
It degrades ecosystems and threatens marine life
It has no significant impact on marine environments
questions.answer: It degrades ecosystems and threatens marine life

questions.question: What is bioaccumulation?
choices: The process of recycling organic waste
The gradual accumulation of substances in an organism
The breakdown of plastics in the ocean
The natural purification of water in rivers
questions.answer: The gradual accumulation of substances in an organism

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common heavy metal contaminant in Timor-Leste?
questions.answer: Helium

questions.question: What is a potential long-term consequence of persistent organic pollutants in Timor-Leste?
choices: Long-term environmental contamination and health issues
questions.answer: Long-term environmental contamination and health issues

questions.question: Which economic sectors in Timor-Leste are most likely to be affected by marine plastic pollution?
questions.answer: Fishing and tourism

questions.question: What is a circular economy?
choices: An economy based on circular reasoning
A system aimed at eliminating waste and continual use of resources
An economy focused solely on recycling
A financial system using only coins
questions.answer: A system aimed at eliminating waste and continual use of resources

questions.question: Which international agreement is relevant to managing persistent organic pollutants in Timor-Leste?
questions.answer: Stockholm Convention

questions.question: What is a major source of plastic pollution in Timor-Leste's marine environments?
choices: Improper waste disposal and coastal activities
questions.answer: Improper waste disposal and coastal activities

questions.question: Which ecosystem in Timor-Leste is particularly vulnerable to chemical pollution?
questions.answer: Coral reefs

questions.question: What role can traditional ecological knowledge play in addressing waste management in Timor-Leste?
choices: It has no relevance to modern waste management
It can provide insights into sustainable practices and local solutions
It only applies to agricultural practices
It is primarily used for cultural ceremonies
questions.answer: It can provide insights into sustainable practices and local solutions

questions.question: What is a potential health impact of heavy metal contamination in water sources?
questions.answer: Neurological damage and kidney problems

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a suggested solution for waste management challenges in Timor-Leste?
choices: Increasing the production of single-use plastics
questions.answer: Increasing the production of single-use plastics

questions.question: What is the primary concern with microplastics in marine environments?
choices: They provide food for marine animals
They can be ingested by marine life and enter the food chain
They help in the formation of new islands
questions.answer: They can be ingested by marine life and enter the food chain

questions.question: How does rapid urbanization in Timor-Leste contribute to chemical pollution?
choices: It leads to more efficient waste management
It increases waste generation and improper disposal
It promotes the use of biodegradable materials
questions.answer: It increases waste generation and improper disposal

questions.question: What is a potential economic opportunity arising from addressing plastic pollution in Timor-Leste?
choices: Development of recycling industries and eco-friendly alternatives
questions.answer: Development of recycling industries and eco-friendly alternatives

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a community-based initiative to address chemical pollution?
choices: Organizing beach cleanups and waste audits
Promoting the use of single-use plastics
Encouraging the use of chemical fertilizers
questions.answer: Organizing beach cleanups and waste audits

questions.question: What role does international cooperation play in addressing chemical pollution in Timor-Leste?
choices: It has no impact on local pollution issues
It can provide technical support, funding, and access to global expertise
It focuses solely on diplomatic relations
questions.answer: It can provide technical support, funding, and access to global expertise

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a direct impact of chemical pollution on Timor-Leste's ecosystems?
questions.answer: Increased biodiversity in polluted areas

questions.question: What is a key challenge in implementing effective waste management in rural areas of Timor-Leste?
questions.answer: Geographical challenges for waste collection

questions.question: How can the adoption of circular economy principles benefit Timor-Leste in terms of chemical pollution?
choices: By increasing the production of synthetic materials
By promoting the use of single-use products
By minimizing waste generation and promoting resource reuse
By encouraging the import of more chemicals
questions.answer: By minimizing waste generation and promoting resource reuse

questions.question: What is a potential consequence of bioaccumulation of pollutants in Timor-Leste's food chains?
choices: Health risks for humans consuming contaminated food
questions.answer: Health risks for humans consuming contaminated food
